etymologies: late Middle English: of unknown origin

definitions: a large brown seaweed that typically has a long, tough stalk with a broad frond divided into strips. Some kinds grow to a very large size and form underwater “forests” that support a large population of animals

examples.text: there are several kelps found in the lower zones

notes.text: Family Laminariaceae, class Phaeophyceae, including the genera Laminaria (used in some areas as manure) and Macrocystis (harvested in the US as a source of algin)

definitions: the calcined ashes of seaweed, used as a source of various salts.
shortDefinitions: calcined ashes of seaweed, used as source of various salts
